disclaimer: This information is for educational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice. Consult a licensed attorney for legal guidance.

dismissedCharges.name: Dismissed or Acquitted Charges
dismissedCharges.description: Process for expunging charges that were dismissed or resulted in acquittal
eligibilityCriteria: All charges in the case dismissed
No plea bargain resulting in conviction
process: Obtain certified copy of dismissal order or acquittal
Court reviews and signs order (usually within 30 days)
dismissedCharges.fees: No state filing fee; some counties charge small administrative fee

judicialDiversion.name: Judicial Diversion
judicialDiversion.description: Process for expunging records after successful completion of judicial diversion
eligibilityCriteria: All fines and court costs paid
process: Obtain Certificate of Completion from probation/supervision
judicialDiversion.fees: No state filing fee; administrative fees may apply

pretrialDiversion.name: Pretrial Diversion
pretrialDiversion.description: Process for expunging records after successful completion of pretrial diversion
process: Obtain Certificate of Completion from District Attorney
pretrialDiversion.fees: No state filing fee; administrative fees may apply

misdemeanorConviction.name: Misdemeanor Conviction
misdemeanorConviction.description: Process for expunging eligible misdemeanor convictions
eligibilityCriteria: Conviction for eligible misdemeanor (see ineligible list)
All court obligations satisfied (fines, costs, probation)
No other expungement within past 5 years
ineligibleMisdemeanors: Criminal contempt in domestic violence case
process: Obtain proof of sentence completion and payment of all costs
Attend hearing if required (often waived for misdemeanors)
misdemeanorConviction.fees: No state filing fee; administrative fees may apply

felonyConviction.name: Non-Violent Felony Conviction
felonyConviction.description: Process for expunging eligible non-violent felony convictions
eligibilityCriteria: Conviction for eligible non-violent Class E felony
All court obligations satisfied (fines, restitution, costs, probation)
No prior expungement within past 5 years
No convictions during the 5-year waiting period
process: Obtain proof of sentence completion and payment of all costs
Attend hearing (may be required for felonies)
felonyConviction.fees: No state filing fee; administrative fees may apply

general: Proof of payment of all fines, costs, and restitution
dismissed: Certified copy of dismissal order or acquittal

timelineFactors.impact: May add 30-60 days to processing time
Requires hearing and may extend timeline significantly
Each charge may require separate processing

options: Wait and refile if eligibility issues can be resolved
appealsProcess.note: Consult an attorney if your expungement is denied
